description: A flavonoid compound with potential anti-inflammatory effects.
A chronic inflammatory bowel disease causing inflammation in the digestive tract.
IκB kinase, part of the signaling pathway involved in inflammation.
Inhibitor of kappa B, a protein family that regulates the NF-kB signaling pathway.
Nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells, a transcription factor involved in inflammatory responses.
Superoxide dismutase, an enzyme that helps break down potentially harmful oxygen molecules.
Catalase, an enzyme that catalyzes the decomposition of hydrogen peroxide.
Glutathione peroxidase, an enzyme that protects the organism from oxidative damage.
A marker of oxidative stress.
Interleukin 1 beta, a cytokine involved in inflammatory responses.
Myeloperoxidase, an enzyme expressed in neutrophils that contributes to inflammation.
A lipid compound that has various roles in inflammation and pain.
Tumor necrosis factor alpha, a cytokine involved in systemic inflammation.
An active form of caspase 3, involved in the apoptotic process.
An active form of caspase 9, also involved in apoptosis.
B-cell lymphoma 2, a protein that regulates cell death.
Bcl-2-associated X protein, a pro-apoptotic member of the Bcl-2 family.
Cytochrome c, a protein involved in the electron transport chain and apoptosis.
A subunit of the NF-kB protein complex involved in immune response.
Phosphorylated and non-phosphorylated forms of IκB kinase beta, involved in the NF-kB signaling pathway.
Phosphorylated and non-phosphorylated forms of inhibitor of kappa B alpha, regulating NF-kB activity.
